gameplay

Class GamePanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • gameplay.GamePanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class GamePanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.lang.Runnable
    GamePanel acts as the game engine. A Java thread throws an event every 40ms which is caught by the run method. The run method then runs the gameUpdate method which updates all the game elements and then runs the gameRender method which gets all the gameObjects to draw themselves on a graphics object and finally the paintScreen method displays the screens to the user.
    Author:
    MF
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
